com.mousebird.maply

Class GeoJSONSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.GeoJSONSource

  • public class GeoJSONSource
extends java.lang.Object
    The GeoJSONSource will load vector features from a GeoJSON document, style them with an SLD document, and add them to the globe or map. To use GeoJSONSource first construct one, then set the styleSet, the jsonStream, and the baseController, and finally call startParse() to parse the JSON features, apply the styles, and add them to the globe or map.

      • setJsonStream

        public void setJsonStream(java.io.InputStream jsonStream)
        Sets the InputStream from which the JSON document will be read.
        Parameters:
        jsonStream - The InputStream object which is the source of the JSON document.

      • setBaseController

        public void setBaseController(RenderControllerInterface baseController)
        Sets the globe or map controller to which vector features will be added.
        Parameters:
        baseController - The MaplyBaseController instance.

      • startParse

        public void startParse()
        Start parsing the GeoJSON. This will load the features, apply the styles, and add the styled features to the globe or map.

      • startParse

        public void startParse(java.lang.Runnable completionBlock)
        Start parsing the GeoJSON. Call this method if you have a custom Runnable that should be executed after completion. This will load the features, apply the styles, and add the styled features to the globe or map.
        Parameters:
        completionBlock - Block to execute after completion.
